title: 1989 Women's Junior World Handball Championship
text:
The 1989 Women's Junior World Handball Championship was the seventh edition of the <a href="Women%27s%20Junior%20World%20Handball%20Championship">tournament</a> which took place in <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a> from 22 September to 1 October 1989. Fifteen teams competed in the competition from three continents with <a href="Algeria%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">Algeria</a>, <a href="Switzerland%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">Switzerland</a> and <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">Turkey</a> making their first appearance in a tournament.
In the final, the <a href="Soviet%20Union%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">Soviet Union</a> took home their sixth gold medal and their fourth in a row after defeating <a href="South%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">South Korea</a> by three goals. <a href="Bulgaria%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">Bulgaria</a> claimed their first junior medal after defeating <a href="Yugoslavia%20women%27s%20national%20junior%20handball%20team">Yugoslavia</a> for third.
